org.agreement_technologies.common.map_dtg

Interface DTG

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DTGImp

    public interface DTG
    DTG is the interface that represents a Domain Transition Graph of a variable.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int INFINITE 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearCache(int threadIndex)
      Clears the cache, which stores already computed paths for value transitions.
      int getDistance(java.lang.String initValue, java.lang.String endValue, int threadIndex)
      Returns the distance (in number of actions) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value.
      java.lang.String[] getPath(java.lang.String initValue, java.lang.String endValue, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> state, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> newValues, int threadIndex)
      Returns the path (list of values) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value.
      java.lang.String[] getPathMulti(java.lang.String initValue, java.lang.String endValue)
      Returns the path (list of values) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value.
      DTGTransition getTransition(java.lang.String initValue, java.lang.String endValue)
      Gets information about the transition for the current variable from an intial value to an end value.
      DTGTransition[] getTransitionsFrom(java.lang.String fromValue)
      Returns the set of transitions for this variable that start from a given initial value.
      DTGTransition[] getTransitionsTo(java.lang.String endValue)
      Returns the set of transitions for this variable that finish in a given end value.
      java.lang.String getVarName()
      Gets the name of the current variable.
      int pathCost(java.lang.String initValue, java.lang.String endValue, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> state, java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> newValues, int threadIndex)
      Returns the path cost (in number of actions) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value.
      int pathCostMulti(java.lang.String initValue, java.lang.String endValue)
      Returns the path cost (in number of actions) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value.
      boolean unknownValue(java.lang.String value)
      Checks if a given value for this variable is not known by this agent.

    • Method Detail

      • pathCost

        int pathCost(java.lang.String initValue,
           java.lang.String endValue,
           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> state,
           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> newValues,
           int threadIndex)
        Returns the path cost (in number of actions) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value. This method is not designed for multi-agent evaluation.
        Parameters:
        initValue - Initial value
        endValue - End value
        state - Current state
        newValues - Already achieved values for all the variables
        threadIndex - Thread index (for multi-thread purposes)
        Returns:
        Path cost
        Since:
        1.0

      • pathCostMulti

        int pathCostMulti(java.lang.String initValue,
                java.lang.String endValue)
        Returns the path cost (in number of actions) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value. Unlike the pathCost method, this one is designed for multi-agent evaluation.
        Parameters:
        initValue - Initial value
        endValue - End value
        Returns:
        Path cost
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPathMulti

        java.lang.String[] getPathMulti(java.lang.String initValue,
                              java.lang.String endValue)
        Returns the path (list of values) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value. This method is designed for multi-agent evaluation.
        Parameters:
        initValue - Initial value
        endValue - End value
        Returns:
        Array of values
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTransition

        DTGTransition getTransition(java.lang.String initValue,
                          java.lang.String endValue)
        Gets information about the transition for the current variable from an intial value to an end value.
        Parameters:
        initValue - Initial value
        endValue - End value
        Returns:
        Transition information
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        DTGTransition

      • getVarName

        java.lang.String getVarName()
        Gets the name of the current variable.
        Returns:
        Name of the variable
        Since:
        1.0

      • getPath

        java.lang.String[] getPath(java.lang.String initValue,
                         java.lang.String endValue,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> state,
                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> newValues,
                         int threadIndex)
        Returns the path (list of values) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value. This method is not designed for multi-agent evaluation.
        Parameters:
        initValue - Initial value
        endValue - End value
        state - Current state
        newValues - Already achieved values for all the variables
        threadIndex - Thread index (for multi-thread purposes)
        Returns:
        Array of values
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTransitionsFrom

        DTGTransition[] getTransitionsFrom(java.lang.String fromValue)
        Returns the set of transitions for this variable that start from a given initial value.
        Parameters:
        fromValue - Initial value
        Returns:
        Array of transitions
        Since:
        1.0

      • getTransitionsTo

        DTGTransition[] getTransitionsTo(java.lang.String endValue)
        Returns the set of transitions for this variable that finish in a given end value.
        Parameters:
        endValue - End value
        Returns:
        Array of transitions
        Since:
        1.0

      • unknownValue

        boolean unknownValue(java.lang.String value)
        Checks if a given value for this variable is not known by this agent.
        Parameters:
        value - Value to check
        Returns:
        true if this agent does not know this value; false, otherwise
        Since:
        1.0

      • getDistance

        int getDistance(java.lang.String initValue,
              java.lang.String endValue,
              int threadIndex)
        Returns the distance (in number of actions) for the currect variable to change from a given initial value to the given end value. This method is not designed for multi-agent evaluation.
        Parameters:
        initValue - Initial value
        endValue - End value
        threadIndex - Thread index (for multi-thread purposes)
        Returns:
        Distance in number of actions
        Since:
        1.0

      • clearCache

        void clearCache(int threadIndex)
        Clears the cache, which stores already computed paths for value transitions.
        Parameters:
        threadIndex - Thread index (for multi-thread purposes)
        Since:
        1.0
